intro: Antirrhinum acutangulum, commonly known as the sharp-leaved snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, two-lipped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Antirrhinum acutangulum is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
